items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued, because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely this morning and into the afternoon. Water levels continue to remain high. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning. Flood water is dangerous. Don't put yourself or others at risk. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Tuesday 7th December 2021.
The flood alert for the North Sea coast at Bridlington has been removed. The situation is improving and no further flooding is expected in this area.

River levels remain high as a result of recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today Monday 06/12/2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land around the River Rye and its tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck and Spittle Beck. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated on Monday evening, 06/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

Tuesday's tides at 11:00 AM  and 11:45 PM will be higher than normal due to stormy conditions associated with Storm Barra. 
South-westerly force 8 winds and large waves will produce a swell within the harbour.
Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour side and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon.
We are closing flood gates in the area.
Our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
People in the areas should consider taking action now. We urge all people to take care and not drive or walk through flood water.
This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

Tuesday's tide at 10:30 AM  and 00:30 AM on Wednesday will be higher than normal due to stormy conditions associated with Storm Barra. 
South-westerly force 8 winds and large waves will produce a swell within the harbour.
Areas most at risk include The Quomps, Mudeford and the Stanpit area
Our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
People in the areas should consider taking action now. We urge all people to take care and not drive or walk through flood water.
This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message: River levels have risen at the Deepmore Farm river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between 18:00 to 23:00, Monday, 06/12/2021. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook. Further rainfall is possible over the next 8 hours. We expect river levels to rise until later this evening 06/12/2021. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Tuesday, 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but are beginning to fall at the Willington and Shardlow river gauges as a result of heavy rainfall.  Flooding continues.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 07/12/21, or as the situation changes.
River levels on the River Riccal have fallen below the levels of concern. We continue to monitor the situation. Please check the .GOV website for up to date information for the next 5 days.

River levels remain high at the Hints river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.
Consequently, the risk of flooding of roads and farmland remains overnight into Tuesday, 07/12/21.
Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the Bourne Brook.   
Further rainfall is expected over the next 24 hours.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast, and clearing weed screens. 
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 07/12/21 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Derwent remains in force as river levels are rising slowly following rainfall over the weekend. River levels are forecast to rise through Monday and into Tuesday, and are expected to return to levels similar to those seen on Friday 3 December. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Monday, 06/12/2021 and on Tuesday 07/12/2021. Further rainfall is forecast on Tuesday and river levels could remain high until later in the week. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated on Monday evening, 06/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: The flood alert for the North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea has been removed. The situation is improving and no further flooding is expected in this area.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
The high tide at 01:00 AM on Tuesday 07/12/2021 is currently not expected to reach flood alert levels. However, forecasts indicate that further alerts/warnings may be issued from Tuesday to Wednesday as high tides coincide with Storm Barra leading to increased surge.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 12:15 PM on 06/12/2021.
Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads at Fiddlers Ferry, Eastford Road and Arpley Bridge. It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge between 01:30 PM and 02:30 PM on 06/12/2021.

River levels at Fiddlers Ferry will peak at 6.43m between 01:00 PM and 02:00 PM. 
River levels at Eastford Road will peak at 6.60m between 01:15 PM and 02:15 PM. 
River levels at Arpley Bridge will peak at 6.62m between 01:30 PM and 02:30 PM. 

After this tide no further impacts are expected. However, we will continue to monitor levels closely.
We will remove this message by 05:00 PM on 06/12/2021.

items.description: Lune estuary south west of Lancaster
items.message:
The high tide at 00:45 AM on Tuesday 07/12/2021 is currently not expected to reach flood alert levels. However, forecasts indicate that further alerts/warnings may be issued from Tuesday to Wednesday as high tides coincide with Storm Barra leading to increased surge.

We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.

items.message:

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. Coastal conditions have now eased and the threat of overtopping has reduced along the Tyne and Wear Coast.
No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds and moderate waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.38 metres Chart Datum (2.65 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, the water level will be very high at South Street and Queen Street, Emsworth. The Ship Inn car park, Langstone, will flood. Water may flow across the A259 junction with Lumley Road, flooding driveways. Road flooding will affect the bottom third of Langstone High Street. The depth of flood water in roads may be up to 0.2 m. At 01:45 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be similar in magnitude. We'll issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. In Emsworth, to protect property, we will install drop boards at The Promenade (southern end of the Mill Pond). If you have it, please install flood protection 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:15 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to Storm Barra, which brings Gale Force 8 Southerly winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.4 m. The total forecast tide is 6.40 metres Chart Datum (3.35 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 1 hour either side of high water, Mill Lane, Sidlesham will flood, making access temporarily more difficult. Wind blown spray will likely affect exposed beach top properties between Selsey Bill and Elmer. The early Wednesday morning tide, at 01:45 08/12/2021 is predicted to be 10 cm lower, but will be accompanied by very large waves. We expect flood impacts could be similar. Strong winds and large waves will continue until Thursday. We continue to monitor the forecast. If you have it, please install flood protection 1 hour before high tide. Avoid driving on Mill Lane at high tide. We will update this message by 16:00 on 07/12/2021.

items.description: Tidal areas of Littlehampton Rope Walk
items.message: Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:15 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to Storm Barra, which brings Gale Force 8 Southerly winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.4 m. The total forecast tide is 6.40 metres Chart Datum (3.35 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high water, the tide will cause flooding to boatyards and the industrial areas along Littlehampton Rope Walk. Water will be high up slipways and could be forced up through drains, causing flooding to roads. The early Wednesday morning tide, at 01:45 08/12/2021 is predicted to be 10 cm lower, but will be accompanied by very large waves. We expect flood impacts could be similar. Strong winds and large waves will continue until Thursday. We continue to monitor the forecast. If you have it, please install flood protection 2 hours before high tide. We will update this message by 16:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:15 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to Storm Barra, which brings Gale Force 8 Southerly winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.4 m. The total forecast tide is 6.40 metres Chart Datum (3.35 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, shallow water will affect land and fields at Climping beach. Water may pond in Climping Street Car Park and on Mill Lane. Waves overtopping the sea front could potentially direct water along Mill Lane (from the right of the east car park) towards properties on Climping Street. Wednesday morning's tide at 01:45 08/12/2021 is similar, but accompanied by very large waves. We expect more water to collect on land and in fields. We continue to monitor the forecast. We recycled shingle in November and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Avoid walking on the beach or parking at Climping Street Car Park. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. We will update this message by 16:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:30 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to Storm Barra, which brings Gale Force 8 South Easterly winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.35 metres Chart Datum (2.61 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. For 1 hour either side of high water, the tide will flood Shore Road. At Bosham High Street water will be near to, or flood, front door steps. Around the harbour, some gardens or land at shore side properties could also be affected. The early Wednesday morning tide at 01:30 08/12/2021, is predicted to be 10 cm lower, but will be accompanied by very large waves. We expect flood impacts could be similar. Strong winds and large waves will continue until Thursday. We continue to monitor the forecast. If you have them, please install flood boards 1 hour before high tide. Avoid walking through flood water as it may contain hidden hazards and be deep in places. We will update this message by 16:00 on 07/12/2021.

items.description: Tidal River Camel excluding Wadebridge and Chapel Amble
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning. High water at Padstow is at 19:36 on Tuesday 7th December and 07:59 on Wednesday 8th December, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong Force 8 south westerly winds, veering north westerly, and offshore wave heights of over 7m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. 

Locations particularly at risk include the A389 at Sladesbridge 

Expect tides to be around 600mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

With strong wind and large waves seafront areas will be dangerous. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.    

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.  

This message will be updated by 4pm on Tuesday 7th December.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from The Rumps to Hartland Point excluding Bude
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning. High water at Padstow is at 19:36 on Tuesday 7th December and 07:59 on Wednesday 8th December, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong Force 8 south westerly winds, veering north westerly, and offshore wave heights of over 7m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Edge of quays likely to flood including any low lying car parks and roads with particular emphasis on Port Quinn, Port Isaac and Port Gaverne, Boscastle and Crooklets Beach 

Expect tides to be around 600mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

With strong wind and large waves seafront areas will be dangerous. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.    

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.  

This message will be updated by 4pm on Tuesday 7th December.

Strong Force 8 south westerly winds, veering north westerly, and offshore wave heights of over 7m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Edge of quays likely to flood including any low lying car parks and roads with particular emphasis on Trevaunance Cove, Perranporth, Newquay, Mawgan Porth, Trevone and Polzeath.

Expect tides to be around 600mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions.

With strong wind and large waves seafront areas will be dangerous. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from Lands End to Chapel Porth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tides on Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning. High water at St Ives is at 19:19 on Tuesday 7th December and 07:44 on Wednesday 8th December, times of high water will vary along the coast.

Strong Force 8 south westerly winds, veering north westerly, and offshore wave heights of over 7m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations including St Ives Harbour, Portreath Harbour and the Causeway at Hayle.

Expect tides to be around 600mm higher than predicted because of forecast weather conditions.

With strong wind and large waves seafront areas will be dangerous. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.   

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

This message will be updated by 4pm on Tuesday 7th December.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 12:41 and 14:34 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.6 m. The total forecast tide is 4.24 metres Chart Datum (2.24 mAOD) at Beaulieu. The tide is highest at the time of second high water. For 1 hour either side of high tide, water will flood into the garden of the Mill House on the downstream side of the Mill Pond. Palace Lane will also flood, making access to the village temporarily more difficult. At 01:18 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be slightly higher in magnitude. We will issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. For safety, please take care if walking or driving through Beaulieu. The incoming tide will flood the main road quickly. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 12:41 and 14:34 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.6 m. The total forecast tide is 5.17 metres Chart Datum (2.43 mAOD) at Southampton. The tide is highest at the time of second high water. For 1 hour either side of high tide, levels in the lower River Itchen will increase as the incoming tide prevents water from flowing out to sea. Footpath flooding will affect some areas of Riverside Park. The pub car park at Mansbridge may see minor impact flooding for a short period of time. The tide will not flood property or the A27. At 01:18 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be slightly higher in magnitude. We will issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast, and may operate the structure at Woodmill, if required. Please consider closing the defence gates around the pub. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

items.description: Cumbrian coastline at Duddon estuary, between Haverigg, Duddon Bridge, Dunnerholme and A595
Cumbrian coastline at Duddon estuary, at Haverigg to Duddon Bridge, Foxfield, Dunnerholme

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels are beginning to fall and there is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
The forecast continues to be unsettled over the next few days. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels are beginning to fall and there is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
The forecast continues to be unsettled over the next few days. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible throughout Tuesday 7th December. High water on Tuesday at Teignmouth is at 08:30, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Force 8 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of 1.4m are forecast. Strong winds and large waves are forecast throughout Tuesday, which could result in wave overtopping of sea defences and localised flooding in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be up to 0.28m higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required. 

Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Teignmouth on Tuesday 7th December at 08:30 is 2.48 mAOD, this is 0.28 metres above astronomical tide level.

items.description: South Devon coast from Dawlish Warren to Seaton
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible throughout Tuesday 7th December. High water on Tuesday at Exmouth is at 09:00, times of high water will vary along the coast.

Force 7 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of 1.5m are forecast. Strong winds and large waves are forecast throughout Tuesday, which could result in wave overtopping of sea defences and localised flooding in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be up to 0.23m higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required. 

Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Exmouth on Tuesday 7th December is at 09:00 is 2.35 mAOD, this is 0.23 metres above astronomical tide level.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 12:22 and 14:30 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.58 m. The total forecast tide is 3.96 metres Chart Datum (1.98 mAOD) at Lymington. The tide will be highest at the time of second high water. For 1 hour either side of high tide, water will flood the footpath near the Ship Inn pub, Town Quay. Saltgrass Lane will flood and be completely impassable to traffic. In Milford-on-Sea High Street, near the Smugglers Inn pub, the river will increase with the tide and come close to the top of the river bank, possibly flooding footpaths. The tide will not flood property. At 01:09 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide will be similar in magnitude. We will issue further advice. To protect property from flooding, at Keyhaven and Lymington, our tidal defence gates will be closed for 2 hours either side of high water. All private defence gates should be closed. Any cars parked at Saltgrass Lane will flood. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 12:41 and 14:34 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.6 m. The total forecast tide is 5.17 metres Chart Datum (2.43 mAOD) at Southampton. The tide is highest at the time of second high water. For 1 hour either side of high tide, minor impact flooding will affect the lower floor level of Eling Tide Mill and boat yards at Bursledon. Road and car park flooding will occur at The Quay in Hamble, the Rising Sun pub in Warsash, Magazine Lane at Marchwood, Shore Road, and Promenade in Hythe. At 01:18 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be slightly higher in magnitude. We will issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. Avoid parking in low lying coastal car parks, and plan driving routes to avoid the roads listed above. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.52 m. The total forecast tide is 4.90 metres Chart Datum (2.31 mAOD) at Cowes. For 1 hour either side of high water, flooding will affect sea front roads, esplanades and car parks across the island. Water will be high up slipways in Cowes, affecting Medina Road and the Floating Bridge. In East Cowes, sea water forced up through drains may cause minor impacts to the road at Albany Road. The ferry terminal car park at Yarmouth will also flood. At 01:46 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be of a similar magnitude. We'll issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. At Medina Road, near the Floating Bridge, the tide may rise to be approximately 0.1 m below the top of front door steps. As a precautionary measure, and if you have it, we recommend that flood protection is installed at Medina Road and Bridge Road at Yarmouth, 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds and moderate waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.38 metres Chart Datum (2.65 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high tide, water may just exceed the top of the main slipway, flooding the road at Lower Quay, Fareham. The lower end of Wallington Shore Road will flood to a depth of 0.1 m. Some tidal spray and debris may affect the A27 at Portchester. At 01:45 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be similar in magnitude. We'll issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. We recommend that cars do not park at the lower end of Wallington Shore Road. At Lower Quay, as a precautionary measure, and if you have it, please install flood protection 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

floodArea.riverOrSea: The Solent, Portsmouth Harbour, Langstone Harbour

items.message: Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds and moderate waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.38 metres Chart Datum (2.65 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, in Old Portsmouth, the tide may just exceed the top of the main slipway which will cause minor road flooding in East Street and to the boat yards at The Camber. Spray overtopping of defence walls at Southsea promenade and Eastern Road is also expected. To protect property in Old Portsmouth, tidal defence gates will be closed. At 01:45 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be similar in magnitude. We'll issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. We are liaising with the local authority over flood defence gate closures. Avoid walking at exposed sea front locations at high tide. Spray and waves may carry and throw shingle and debris onto roads and footpaths. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.38 metres Chart Datum (2.65 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, the main road at Northney will flood. At South Hayling, strong winds and moderate to large waves could move shingle on the beach. Some minor impact garden and road flooding may occur at Southwood Road, Bembridge Drive, Meath Close and The Strand. At 01:45 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be similar in magnitude. We will issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. We are liaising with the local authority over the beach condition at South Hayling. Avoid South Hayling seafront at high tide. Shingle and debris can be thrown by strong winds and large waves. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

Tuesday afternoon's tide at 13:00 on 07/12/2021 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Easterly Force 7 winds and moderate waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.46 m. The total forecast tide is 5.38 metres Chart Datum (2.65 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 30 minutes either side of high water, spray overtopping of sea defence walls into low lying coastal roads is expected between Hillhead and Gosport, namely Cliff Road and Stokes Bay Road. At Hillhead, low lying sea front car parks may flood. Property flooding is not expected. At 01:45 on 08/12/2021‚ the tide may be similar in magnitude. We'll issue further advice. We continue to monitor the forecast. Be careful if driving, parking or walking at Gosport sea front at high tide. Some shingle and debris could reach and impact the main road at Stokes Bay. We will update this message by 19:00 on 07/12/2021.

A large tidal surge is expected with possible overtopping and onshore flooding as a result of high water levels. The time and date of the first forecast high water is 09:00 am on 07/12/2021. The forecast tide level is 7.12 m AOD. The forecast wind strength and direction is Force 7 in a south easterly direction. The time and date of the second forecast high water is 21:15 on 07/12/2021. The forecast tide level is 7.15 m AOD. The forecast wind strength and direction is Force 7 in a south westerly direction. 
There is a possibility of flooding for the Severn estuary at Severn Beach, including New Passage and Pilning. Conditions may apply one/two hours either side of the high tide.
Be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads. 
Please note all tide times are in local time and are using the 24 hour clock and refer to the high water time at Avonmouth.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Rame Head to Plymouth including tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over both of the high tides on Tuesday 7th December. High water at Plymouth is at 7:33 and 20:04. Times of high water will vary along the coast. 

Strong Force 7 southerly winds increasing to Force 8 and veering south westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 6m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Locations particularly at risk include: Kingsand, Cawsand, harbours and coastal car parks, ferry terminals and quaysides exposed to the open sea and vulnerable to large waves.  Expect tides to be around 500mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. 

With strong wind and large waves seafront areas will be dangerous. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. 

Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
Storm Barra is forecast to bring strong winds, large waves and spray overtopping on the coast on Tuesday. Winds are forecast to be South South Westerly Force 8 gusting to 50 knots at times.
Time off high water at locations along the East Dorset Coast is as follows:
Weymouth Preston Beach at 08:30 AM and 09:00 PM,
Swanage Bay at 10:20 AM and 11:15 PM,
Poole Harbour at Wareham at 12:00 mid day and 01:45 AM on Wednesday,
and Christchurch Harbour at 02:00 PM and 01:30 AM on Wednesday.
Our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Stay away from exposed beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

Storm Barra is forecast to bring strong winds, large waves and spray overtopping on the coast on Tuesday. Winds are forecast to be South South Westerly Force 8 gusting to 50 knots at times.
Time of high water at locations along the West Dorset Coast is at 08:45 AM and 09:15 PM on Tuesday 07/12/2021
Our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Stay away from exposed beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. Avoid walking close to cliffs due to the high risk of rock falls in the prevailing conditions.
This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
Tuesday's tide at 10:30 AM  and 00:30 AM on Wednesday will be higher than normal due to stormy conditions associated with Storm Barra. 
South-westerly force 8 winds and large waves will produce a swell within the harbour.
Areas most at risk include Wareham Quayside and Hamworthy.
Our incident response staff are closing flood gates and checking defences.
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
People in the areas should consider taking action now. We urge all people to take care and not drive or walk through flood water.
This message will be updated by 04:00 PM on 07/12/2021, or as the situation changes.
